moves.1. e4 b6 2. Nc3: Preemptively guarding the KP against Black's fianchetto.
moves.2... Bb7 3. Bc4 Na6: Presumably so as not to block the long diagonal.
moves.4. Nh3: In preparation for an advance of the KBP.
moves.4... e5 5. O-O: Tucking the King away before the K-side advance.
moves.5... h6: I assume this was to guard against a potential move of N-N5.
moves.7... f6: Allowing White to open the KB file, and thus a mistake.
